title: The Moving Sidewalks - Flash (1969) [FLAC]
description:
The Moving Sidewalks was a psychedelic garage blues-rock band, notable because of guitarist Billy Gibbons, the later frontman of ZZ Top. The sound of The Moving Sidewalks has nothing to do with ZZ Top - it's typical '60s psychedelic. The band performed as opening act for The Doors and Jimi Hendrix. In 2013 they did some reunion stage acts - not only with their own old songs from their sole album 'Flash' but also as a tribute to Jimi Hendrix and fellow Texas rock-legend Roky Erickson.


tracklist:

(01) Flashback                 
(02) Scoun Da Be               
(03) You Make Me Shake         
(04) You Don't Know The Life   
(05) Pluto - Sept. 31st        
(06) No Good To Cry            
(07) Crimson Witch             
(08) Joe Blues                 
(09) Eclipse                   
(10) Reclipse                  
(11) 99th Floor                
(12) What Ar You Doing To Do   
(13) I Want To Hold Your Hand  
(14) Never Me                  
(15) Every Night A New Surprise

lineup:

Billy Gibbons - guitar, vocals
Tom Moore - keyboards
Don Summers - bass
Dan Mitchell - drums
